intro: Romulea bulbocodium subsp. ramiflora, commonly known as the ramiflorous romulea, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features a short, fleshy bulb and produces clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant blooms with small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a dense, spike-like inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in rock gardens and collections of succulent flora.
